intro: Echidnopsis virchowii var. stellata, commonly known as the star-stemmed rock fig, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that are often subtended by modified leaves called bracts. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
